inquisitive.name: Inquisitive
inquisitive.encouragement: Thanks for completing this section. Albert Einstein once wrote "Curiosity is more important than knowledge." Keep asking those interesting questions.

subhabits.question: How much have you wondered and questioned recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you asked interesting or unusual questions or thought "what if?"

subhabits.question: How much have you explored and investigated recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you thought about some problems and looked in interesting places for information to help solve them?

subhabits.question: How much have you wondered and questioned recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you asked interesting or unusual questions or thought "what if?"

collaborative.name: Collaborative
collaborative.encouragement: Thanks for answering these questions. As Helen Keller once wrote "Alone we can do so little. Together we can do so much." Look for opportunities to collaborate with others.

subhabits.question: How much have you collaborated with others recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you listened carefully to others or worked in a pair or with a group?

subhabits.question: How much have you given and received feedback recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you commented on someone else's work or reflected on comments about yours?

subhabits.question: How much have you shared your work with others recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you read aloud, contributed to a display, published online or shared your work in other ways?

persistent.name: Persistent
persistent.encouragement: Thank you for taking the time to respond. "The best way out is always through", according to the poet Robert Frost. Whatever happens, keep going.

subhabits.question: How often have you kept going recently when the learning was difficult?
subhabits.explanation: Have you worked through challenging tasks and not given up?

subhabits.question: How often have you dared to be different recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you tried something new or thought differently to others?

subhabits.question: How often have you tolerated uncertainty recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you felt unsure about something but carried on anyway?

disciplined.name: Disciplined
disciplined.encouragement: Thanks for your answers. Aristotle thought that the mark of an educated mind was "to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." Remember to take time to reflect on what you've learned.

subhabits.question: How often have you crafted and improved your work recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you re-drafted, refined or developed your work?

subhabits.question: How often have you reflected critically on your work recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you thought about the strengths and weaknesses of your work?

subhabits.question: How often have you developed your techniques recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you learned new ways of doing things or improved the way that you work?

imaginative.name: Imaginative
imaginative.encouragement: Thank you for responding. "You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus," according to the novelist Mark Twain. Don't forget to connect the dots.

subhabits.question: How often have you used your intuition recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you trusted your feelings about something?

subhabits.question: How often have you made connections recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you thought about the links between different topics?

subhabits.question: How often have you played with possibilities recently?
subhabits.explanation: Have you experimented with new ideas, techniques or processes?
